column4: UPDATE 2-Hedge fund manager Kyle Bass loses challenges to pharma patents
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 24 Prominent hedge fund manager Kyle Bass's campaign to wipe out certain drug patents hit a roadblock on Monday when the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office declined to formally review two patents on Acorda Therapeutics Inc's flagship multiple sclerosis drug  Ampyra.

column5: NEW YORK Barclays' U.S. economists pushed out their forecast on the timing of a rate increase from the Federal Reserve to March 2016 from their earlier call of September in the wake of recent volatile market conditions due to anxiety about the Chinese economy.

column5: SINGAPORE  Aug 24 (IFR) - Barclays has appointed Alex Aram head of credit trading for Asia Pacific. He previously led the bank's distressed debt business in the region.

column4: Caesars to pay $20 mln over anti-money laundering lapses -source
column5: ST. LOUIS Caesars Entertainment Corp has agreed to pay $20 million to settle U.S charges over anti-money laundering lapses and will enter into a deferred prosecution agreement with the Justice Department  said a source familiar with the matter.

column4: Market turmoil threatens Fed's rate hike plans
column5: WASHINGTON/NEW YORK  Aug 24 Turmoil in world financial markets and growing fears of a China-led global economic slowdown threaten to derail the Federal Reserve's plans to start raising rates from near zero  making the chances of a September lift-off look increasingly remote.

column4: Exclusive: Boeing eyes 'several hundred' layoffs in satellite division
column5: WASHINGTON Boeing Co  on Monday told its workers that it expected to cut as many as "several hundred" jobs in its satellite business through the end of 2015 due to a downturn in U.S. military spending and delays in commercial satellite orders.

column4: China's plunge has emerging market funds looking closer to home
column5: NEW YORK/BOSTON  Aug 24 With Chinese stocks down nearly 9 percent on Monday and Latin American countries already hurting  some top-performing emerging market fund managers are throwing in the towel when it comes to playing once-hot overseas growth stories.

column4: Appeals court sends FedEx driver classification case to Missouri jury
column5: A federal appeals court on Friday overturned a lower court's finding that FedEx drivers in Missouri were employees and not independent contractors  dealing the shipping giant a victory in its nationwide legal battle over job classification.

column5: BEIJING  Aug 24 A General Motors Co joint venture in China will invest 3 billion yuan ($470 million) to build a factory dedicated to green cars  a spokeswoman said on Monday.

column4: ITG dark pool volume fell by nearly half following record fine
column5: Volume in Investment Technology Group's  private stock trading venue fell by nearly half in the week-and-a-half after the brokerage disclosed it was near a record settlement with regulators over violations in its so-called "dark pool " industry data showed.

column4: ITG dark pool volume fell by nearly half following record fine

column4: UK's Osborne says hopes Lloyds sale to be done within a year
column5: HELSINKI  Aug 24 British finance minister George Osborne said on Monday he hoped the sale of the government's shares in Lloyds Banking Group will be completed within a year.

column4: UK cuts its stake in Lloyds to below 13 pct
column5: LONDON  Aug 24 Britain's government has reduced its holding in Lloyds Banking Group to below 13 percent  taking the bank closer to full privatisation after needing a state rescue in the 2008/09 financial crisis.

column5: NEW YORK and CHICAGO U.S.-based Monsanto Co  sweetened its offer to buy Switzerland's Syngenta AG   valuing the company at around $47 billion as it tries to lure the Swiss firm to the negotiating table  a person familiar with the matter said on Monday.

column4: Monsanto sweetens offer for Syngenta to CHF470 a share- source
column5: Aug 24 U.S.-based Monsanto Co has increased its offer to buy Switzerland's Syngenta AG  from CHF 449 per share to CHF 470 per share  a person familiar with the matter said on Monday.

column4: PBF's Delaware City catalytic cracker shut for at least a month -source
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 24 A key gasoline-making unit at PBF Energy Inc's 182 200-barrel-per-day (bpd) Delaware City  Delaware  refinery is expected to be shut for at least a month - and possibly much longer - following an explosion and fire on Friday  a source familiar with plant operations said on Sunday.

column4: Petrobras uneasy with aspects of Sete restructuring -sources
column5: SAO PAULO  Aug 24 State-controlled Petróleo Brasileiro SA is growing uneasy with some aspects of the business reorganization of ailing oil-drilling-rig builder Sete Brasil Participações SA  a situation that may pose risks on the refinancing of $3.8 billion in debt  two sources said on Monday.

column4: Judge narrows lawsuit over Sony's Gran Turismo video games
column5: An Italian floormaker's lawsuit involving Sony's popular Gran Turismo car racing video games has been narrowed by a California federal judge who said Sony's use of the company's trademark is artistic and protected by the First Amendment.
